About.title: About BanskoLab
About.subtitle: BanskoLab is a recognized NGO in Bulgaria, based in the village of Bansko. Mission: to empower marginalized young people through education and technology.

missionVision.title: Our Mission & Vision
missionVision.missionText: To empower marginalized young people (for example, Pomak youth in the Rhodope region) through education and technology. We bridge the digital divide and empower people through practical programs.
missionVision.visionText: Accessible knowledge for all. We create positive social change by connecting people through skill-sharing, learning programmes, community building, and volunteering.

inclusivity.title: Inclusivity
inclusivity.description: Everyone is welcome regardless of background. We include young people with fewer opportunities and provide adaptations.

coCreation.title: Co-creation
coCreation.description: Ideas become small experiments with community support. We work with local stakeholders to co-create solutions.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: We communicate openly about objectives and results. Every program delivers measurable outputs and accountability documents.

participation.title: Participation
participation.description: People can co-create, co-host, innovate, and contribute. We build a community of learners and makers.

howWeWork.title: How we work
howWeWork.description: Our educational approach is non-formal, experiential, and locally grounded. We combine hands-on activities with measurable results. Each project has concrete goals and evidence-based execution.

cta.title: Get involved
cta.description: Become a volunteer or contact us to learn more about our programs and partnership opportunities.

WhatWeDo.title: Four capabilities. One delivery team.
WhatWeDo.subtitle: We deliver transformation through integrated digital systems, learning programmes, field implementation, and replication toolkits.

digitalSystems.title: Digital Systems (and responsible AI)
digitalSystems.description: Co-design digital infrastructure with partners: workflows, automation, monitoring and evaluation pipelines, applied methods, and evidence-grade reporting.

learning.title: Learning and Youth Skills
learning.description: Applied learning delivery with measurable outcomes: youth skills pathways, facilitation, and competency evidence aligned to funder requirements.

fieldDelivery.title: Field Delivery & Micro-infrastructure
fieldDelivery.description: Operational field delivery: logistics, safety, site readiness, access mapping, and micro-infrastructure aligned to compliance standards.

replication.title: Replication Toolkits
replication.description: Reusable toolkits with applied methods: templates, protocols, evidence packs, dissemination assets, and replication guidance.

quality.title: Quality and compliance

Partners.title: Partners and Sponsors
Partners.subtitle: We collaborate with organizations across sectors to deliver sustainable impact in rural communities.

whoWeWorkWith.title: Who we work with
whoWeWorkWith.description: Our partnerships span multiple sectors, enabling comprehensive support for rural transformation and youth development.

sponsorship.title: Sponsorship
sponsorship.description: Pathway to become a partner: We work with organizations that share our values of inclusion, transparency, and measurable impact. Partner collaboration includes co-design, field delivery, and dissemination.

cta.title: Become a sponsor
cta.description: If you are an NGO, school, community group, or collaborator who wants to build education and innovation projects that reduce the digital divide, contact us.

Methodology.title: Our Approach
Methodology.subtitle: Non-formal education, inclusion and diversity, safety and wellbeing, and monitoring and evaluation.

nonFormal.title: Non-formal education
nonFormal.description1: We use the principle of learning by doing, collaboration, and games. In practice, we combine outdoor activities with creative media: young people mark hiking trails, organize village clean-ups, and create their own digital stories. These hands-on exercises strengthen teamwork and ownership.
nonFormal.description2: Example from Chereshovo: hands-on activities (nature trail, village clean-up, digital storytelling).

inclusion.title: Inclusion and diversity
inclusion.description1: We include young people with fewer opportunities and provide adaptations (document readiness). Measures include accessibility, gender equality, and language support. We align with EU guidelines for inclusion.
inclusion.description2: Example: During Chereshovo, we worked with translation support for language barriers and adapted activities for weather conditions and health.

safety.title: Safety and wellbeing
safety.description1: Safety first: each project contains a detailed safety plan with first aid, travel insurance, and a solid supervision ratio. During projects, the team works with codes of conduct and prepares activities for weather conditions and health.
safety.description2: We adapt our methods to participants (for example, translation support for language barriers). Monitoring participant wellbeing throughout the project aligns with our safety plan.

monitoring.title: Monitoring and evaluation
monitoring.description1: Each project is continuously evaluated with examples of tools used. We provide links to outputs and reports as proof of our evidence-based approach.
monitoring.description2: Every program delivers measurable outputs (reports, photo and video documentation) and accountability documents. The proof narrative: we work in rural areas with both heart and discipline, and we show every step and outcome.

cta.title: Learn more about our projects
cta.description: See how we apply this methodology in practice through our youth exchanges and community projects.

Impact.title: Evidence of outcomes, learning, and local change.
Impact.subtitle: We measure outputs, learning outcomes, and partner feedback across every delivery cycle.

outcomesByTheme.title: Outcomes by theme
outcomesByTheme.description: We track learning outcomes across inclusion, employability, community resilience, and civic participation.

cta.title: Request an evidence pack
cta.description: We provide detailed reports, evaluation summaries, and partner references.

TheValley.title: Rural Field Site
TheValley.description1: A rural programme site in the Rhodope region of Bulgaria.
TheValley.description2: Used for partner delivery blocks that combine structured sessions, time outdoors, and clean documentation.
TheValley.arrivalNote: Arrival and access are part of delivery planning.

hero.headline: Learning that feels alive.
hero.description: The setting matters, but the work comes first. We use the calm and the space to run structured sessions, then take learning outside and bring it back into documentation and review.
hero.caption: Same site, different seasons. Same delivery workflow.

deliveryWorkflow.title: Delivery workflow
deliveryWorkflow.intro: A delivery block follows a simple rhythm so learning stays energising and documentation stays consistent.

activityGallery.title: How delivery looks on the ground
activityGallery.intro: These are typical moments from a delivery block, from group flow to quiet work to logistics.

firepit.caption: Outdoor group block. Debrief and reflection after sessions.

porch.caption: Group set-up for partner work sessions and end-of-day review.

reading.caption: Base unit used during multi-day delivery blocks.

hottub.caption: Outdoor set-up used for group flow and hands-on activities.

atv.caption: Planned access and timing during field activities.

logisticsContext.title: Logistics context
logisticsContext.description: Rural mountain terrain. Delivery planning accounts for weather, access, and travel time. Partners receive a logistics brief before any on-site activity.
